questions.questionText: What does the 'private' access level restrict?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Access to the defining scope only.
Access to the entire module.
Access to a specific file only.
Access to all other modules.

questions.questionText: What is the scope of 'fileprivate' access level?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Access restricted to the same file.
Access limited to the current module.
Access limited to subclasses.
Access to all files in the module.
Access within the same module.
Access from any module.
Access only from the defining scope.
Access restricted to subclasses.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of 'public' access level?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Access from any module or file.
Access only within the same file.
Access only within the defining module.
Access limited to specific subclasses.

questions.questionText: What does the 'open' access level enable?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Access and subclassing from any module.
Access only within the same file.
Access and modification within the same module.
Access and subclassing within the same scope.
To restrict modification while allowing reading.
To limit access to the defining scope only.
To allow access from any module.
To allow access only within the same file.

questions.questionText: What is the scope of 'internal' access in a Swift module?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Access within the same module.
Access from any file in the module.
Access across all modules.
Access only within the defining class.

questions.questionText: Which access level provides the most visibility?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Public
Fileprivate
Internal
Private

questions.questionText: What does 'open' access allow that 'public' does not?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Subclassing from any module.
Access from any module.
Access only within the same file.
Access restricted to the module.

questions.questionText: Which access level is the default in Swift?

possibleAnswers.optionText: Internal
Public
Private
Fileprivate
